intro: Gymnadenia buschmanniae, commonly known as the Buschmann's grasspocket, is a rare orchid species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pale yellow to cream-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky habitats, often in grasslands or fynbos vegetation. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, oval-shaped seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
